meanings.definition: The purity or intensity of a color.
meanings.sent1: The chroma of the painting was so vibrant that it caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully adjusted the chroma of the sky to make it more realistic.
meanings.sent3: The clown's outfit had such a high chroma that it almost blinded the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with a chroma of joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The chroma of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The attribute of a color that enables it to be classified as red, blue, green, etc.
meanings.sent1: Each crayon in the box had a different chroma, making it easy to distinguish them.
meanings.sent2: The chroma of the traffic lights helped drivers know when to stop or go.
meanings.sent3: The chroma of the rainbow made it a magical sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His music was a blend of different chromas, creating a unique and harmonious sound.
meanings.sent5: The chroma of the flowers in the garden added a beautiful touch of color to the landscape.

meanings.definition: The degree of saturation of a color.
meanings.sent1: The chroma of the paint was so rich that it covered the canvas in a single stroke.
meanings.sent2: The chroma of the dress was so intense that it stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chef experimented with the chroma of the dish, creating a visually stunning presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a chroma of excitement as she opened the gift.
meanings.sent5: The chroma of the ocean on a sunny day was a mesmerizing shade of blue.
